document.title: Alaska Content Standards: Government and Citizenship

B7F7B240DFE3013126E868A86D17958E.description: understand that economic choices influence public and private institutional decisions.

B7F76670DFE3013126E768A86D17958E.description: understand that wages and productivity depend on investment in physical and human capital; and

B7F720E0DFE3013126E668A86D17958E.description: understand how jobs are created and their role in the economy;

B7F6D3E0DFE3013126E568A86D17958E.description: make informed choices on economic issues;

B7F67B20DFE3013126E468A86D17958E.description: identify and compare the costs and benefits when making choices;

B7F63520DFE3013126E368A86D17958E.description: understand that choices are made because resources are scarce;

B7F5F050DFE3013126E268A86D17958E.description: apply economic principles to actual world situations;

B7F5A470DFE3013126E168A86D17958E.description: A student should understand the impact of economic choices and participate effectively in the local, state, national, and global economies.

B7F564A0DFE3013126E068A86D17958E.description: understand those features of the economy of the state that make it unique, including the importance of natural resources, government ownership and management of resources, Alaska Native regional corporations, the Alaska Permanent Fund Corporation, the Alaska Housing Finance Corporation, and the Alaska Industrial Development and Export Authority; and

B7F52480DFE3013126DF68A86D17958E.description: understand the indicators of an economy's performance, including gross domestic product, inflation, and the unemployment rate;

B7F4DEB0DFE3013126DE68A86D17958E.description: understand the role of self-interest, incentives, property rights, competition, and corporate responsibility in the market economy;

B7F49B00DFE3013126DD68A86D17958E.description: understand the role of economic institutions in the United States, including the Federal Reserve Board, trade unions, banks, investors, and the stock market;

B7F459B0DFE3013126DC68A86D17958E.description: understand the basic concepts of supply and demand, the market system, and profit;

B7F41380DFE3013126DB68A86D17958E.description: understand the role of price in resource allocation;

B7F387D0DFE3013126D968A86D17958E.description: be aware that economic systems determine how resources are used to produce and distribute goods and services;

B7F30870DFE3013126D768A86D17958E.description: understand how the government and the economy interrelate through regulations, incentives, and taxation;

B7F2C620DFE3013126D668A86D17958E.description: A student should understand the economies of the United States and the state and their relationships to the global economy.

B7F28130DFE3013126D568A86D17958E.description: implement ways of solving problems and resolving conflict.

B7F23080DFE3013126D468A86D17958E.description: recognize the value of community service; and

B7F1DDD0DFE3013126D368A86D17958E.description: establish, explain, and apply criteria useful in selecting political leaders;

B7F190C0DFE3013126D268A86D17958E.description: establish, explain, and apply criteria useful in evaluating rules and laws;

B7F13EB0DFE3013126D168A86D17958E.description: exercise political participation by discussing public issues, building consensus, becoming involved in political parties and political campaigns, and voting;

B7F0F310DFE3013126D068A86D17958E.description: recognize that it is important for citizens to fulfill their public responsibilities;

B7F0A710DFE3013126CF68A86D17958E.description: know the important characteristics of citizenship;

B7F05610DFE3013126CE68A86D17958E.description: A student should have the knowledge and skills necessary to participate effectively as an informed and responsible citizen.

B7F01250DFE3013126CD68A86D17958E.description: analyze the causes, consequences, and possible solutions to current international issues.

B7EFCC80DFE3013126CC68A86D17958E.description: understand the purpose and function of international government and non-governmental organizations in the world today; and

B7EF8350DFE3013126CB68A86D17958E.description: understand how national politics and international affairs are interrelated with the politics and interests of the state;

B7EF3EF0DFE3013126CA68A86D17958E.description: evaluate circumstances in which the United States has politically influenced other nations and how other nations have influenced the politics and society of the United States;

B7EEF730DFE3013126C968A86D17958E.description: analyze how domestic politics, the principles of the United States Constitution, foreign policy, and economics affect relations with other countries;

B7EEA340DFE3013126C868A86D17958E.description: A student should understand the role of the United States in international affairs.

B7EE6230DFE3013126C768A86D17958E.description: identify the roles of and relationships among the federal, tribal, and state governments and understand the responsibilities and limits of the roles and relationships.

B7EE20D0DFE3013126C668A86D17958E.description: understand the obligations that land and resource ownership place on the residents and government of the state; and

B7EDDE70DFE3013126C568A86D17958E.description: understand the importance of the multicultural nature of the state;

B7ED96B0DFE3013126C468A86D17958E.description: understand the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act and its impact on the state;

B7ED34A0DFE3013126C368A86D17958E.description: understand the importance of the historical and current roles of Alaska Native communities;

B7ECCFF0DFE3013126C268A86D17958E.description: understand the Constitution of Alaska and Sec. 4 of the Alaska Statehood Act, which is known as the Statehood Compact;

B7EC8420DFE3013126C168A86D17958E.description: accept responsibility for protecting and enhancing the quality of life in the state through the political and governmental processes;

B7EC3250DFE3013126C068A86D17958E.description: understand the various forms of the state's local governments and the agencies and commissions that influence students' lives and property;

B7EBEAC0DFE3013126BF68A86D17958E.description: A student should understand the character of government of the state.

B7EB9E90DFE3013126BE68A86D17958E.description: recognize the role of dissent in the American political system.

B7EB37C0DFE3013126BD68A86D17958E.description: understand the place of law in the American political system; and

B7EADD00DFE3013126BC68A86D17958E.description: distinguish between constitution-based ideals and the reality of American political and social life;

B7EAA000DFE3013126BB68A86D17958E.description: recognize the significance of diversity in the American political system;

B7EA61F0DFE3013126BA68A86D17958E.description: understand the importance of individuals, public opinion, media, political parties, associations, and groups in forming and carrying out public policy;

B7EA22A0DFE3013126B968A86D17958E.description: know how power is shared in the United States' constitutional government at the federal, state, and local levels;

B7E9E140DFE3013126B868A86D17958E.description: understand the United States Constitution, including separation of powers, the executive, legislative, and judicial branches of government, majority rule, and minority rights;

B7E99D40DFE3013126B768A86D17958E.description: recognize American heritage and culture, including the republican form of government, capitalism, free enterprise system, patriotism, strong family units, and freedom of religion;

B7E942E0DFE3013126B668A86D17958E.description: understand the ideals of this nation as expressed in the Declaration of Independence, the United States Constitution, and the Bill of Rights;

B7E8E130DFE3013126B568A86D17958E.description: A student should understand the constitutional foundations of the American political system and the democratic ideals of this nation.

B7E89A40DFE3013126B468A86D17958E.description: compare and contrast how different societies have governed themselves over time and in different places.

B7E85420DFE3013126B368A86D17958E.description: understand how nations organize their governments; and

B7E80760DFE3013126B268A86D17958E.description: understand the meaning of fundamental ideas, including equality, authority, power, freedom, justice, privacy, property, responsibility, and sovereignty;

B7E7BAC0DFE3013126B168A86D17958E.description: understand the necessity and purpose of government;

B7E75FC0DFE3013126B068A86D17958E.description: A student should know and understand how societies define authority, rights, and responsibilities through a governmental process.
